page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: The climate is northern mountain, and thus not for the soft! Rainfall is not so heavy as in the nearby Lake District, but snowfall can be considerable;though modern clearing methods reduce the anxiety of winter isolation. One notable local feature is the HELM WIND which is unique to this part of the Pennines. Locals say that it can 'blow the nebs off geese'! There is a wide range of specialised flora from alpine to small woodland and riverside.Autumn brings a good local wild harvest of crab apples and mushrooms.Fauna includes most small mammals,also foxes,badgers, and the occasional roe deer. Birds of the hills and moors include curlew, buzzard,peregrine, golden plover and ring ouzel, whilst by the becks may be seen dippers and herons.
